intro: Cacalia regia, commonly known as the royal cacalia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, featuring slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are showy, with bright yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of smaller florets. Cacalia regia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
